TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WmpBitmapEncoder extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder
Public NotInheritable Class WmpBitmapEncoder Inherits BitmapEncoder

Docs.summary: Defines an encoder that is used to encode Microsoft Windows Media Photo images.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](~/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] is a new codec that provides better image fidelity than JPEG with smaller file sizes and more features. [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](~/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] images achieve lossy and lossless compression by using a single algorithm. [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](~/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] images support existing metadata standards. For additional information about this format, see [Windows Media Photo Specification](https://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/wmphoto.mspx).
[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](~/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] files do not support preview, global thumbnails, frame level thumbnails, or multiple frames.
Encoding does not work in partial trust. See [WPF Partial Trust Security](~/docs/framework/wpf/wpf-partial-trust-security.md) for information on partial trust.

[!code-cpp[wdpbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/WdpBitmapDecoderEncoder/CPP/WDPEncoderDecoder.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[wdpbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/WdpBitmapDecoderEncoder/CSharp/WDPEncoderDecoder.cs#3)] [!code-vb[wdpbitmapdecoderencoder#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/WdpBitmapDecoderEncoder/VB/WDPEncoderDecoder.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Byte AlphaDataDiscardLevel { System::Byte get(); void set(System::Byte value); };
member this.AlphaDataDiscardLevel : byte with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the level of alpha frequency data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.
Docs.value:
The level of alpha data to discard when encoding the image. The value range is 0 (no data discarded) to 4 (alpha channel completely discarded). The default is 1.
Value
Description
0
No image frequency data is discarded.
1
FlexBits are discarded. The image quality of the image is reduced without changing the effective resolution of the image.
2
HighPass frequency data band is discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 4 in both dimensions.
3
HighPass and LowPass frequency data bands are discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 16 in both dimensions.
4
The alpha channel is completely discarded. The pixel format is changed to reflect the removal of the alpha channel.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has an effect only if <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.CompressedDomainTranscode%2A> is set to `true` and the image contains either a planar or interleaved alpha channel; otherwise, it is ignored.

Docs.exception: The value given is not between 0 and 4.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Byte AlphaQualityLevel { System::Byte get(); void set(System::Byte value); };
member this.AlphaQualityLevel : byte with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the compression quality for a planar alpha channel.
Docs.value: The compression quality for a planar alpha channel image. A value of 1 is considered lossless, and increasing values result in higher compression ratios and lower image quality. The value range is 1 to 255. The default is 1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has an effect only if <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.InterleavedAlpha%2A> is `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property short HorizontalTileSlices { short get(); void set(short value); };
member this.HorizontalTileSlices : int16 with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two horizontal regions.
Docs.value: The number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default is 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.CompressedDomainTranscode%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.HorizontalTileSlices%2A> must be set to 0.
A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value is adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size.
When used in combination with <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.VerticalTileSlices%2A>, a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both properties are set to 1, the image is divided into 4 tiles.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Byte ImageDataDiscardLevel { System::Byte get(); void set(System::Byte value); };
member this.ImageDataDiscardLevel : byte with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the level of image data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.
Docs.value:
The level of image data to discard during a compressed domain encoding of the image. The value range is 0 (no data discarded) to 3 (HighPass and LowPass discarded). The default is 1.
Value
Description
0
No image frequency data is discarded.
1
FlexBits are discarded. The image quality of the image is reduced without changing the effective resolution of the image.
2
HighPass frequency data band is discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 4 in both dimensions.
3
HighPass and LowPass frequency data bands are discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 16 in both dimensions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has an effect only if <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.CompressedDomainTranscode%2A> is set to `true`; otherwise, it is ignored.

Docs.exception: The value given is not between 0 and 3.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Byte OverlapLevel { System::Byte get(); void set(System::Byte value); };
member this.OverlapLevel : byte with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the overlap processing level.
Docs.value:
The overlap processing level. The default is 1.
Value
Description
0
No overlap processing is enabled.
1
One level of overlap processing is enabled. Encoded values of 4x4 blocks are modified based on the values of neighboring blocks.
2
Two levels of overlap processing are enabled. In addition to the first level of processing, encoded values of 16x16 macro blocks are modified based on the values of neighboring macro blocks.

member this.QualityLevel : byte with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the compression quality for the main image.
Docs.value: The compression quality for the main image. A value of 1 is considered lossless, and higher values indicate a high compression ratio and lower image quality. The range is 1 to 255. The default is 1.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Byte SubsamplingLevel { System::Byte get(); void set(System::Byte value); };
member this.SubsamplingLevel : byte with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the sub-sampling level for RGB image encoding.
Docs.value:
The sub-sampling level for RGB image encoding. The range is 0 to 3. The default is 3.
Value
Description
0
4:0:0 encoding. Chroma content is discarded; luminance is preserved.
1
4:2:0 encoding. Chroma resolution is reduced by 1/4 of luminance resolution.
2
4:2:2 encoding. Chroma resolution is reduced to 1/2 of luminance resolution.
3
4:4:4 encoding. Chroma resolution is preserved.
Docs.exception: The value given is not between 0 and 3.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseCodecOptions { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseCodecOptions : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates codec options are to be used.
Docs.value: if codec options are to be used; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.UseCodecOptions%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.QualityLevel%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.OverlapLevel%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.SubsamplingLevel%2A> are used in place of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.ImageQualityLevel%2A>.
When <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.UseCodecOptions%2A> is `false`, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.QualityLevel%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.OverlapLevel%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.SubsamplingLevel%2A> are set based on <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.ImageQualityLevel%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property short VerticalTileSlices { short get(); void set(short value); };
member this.VerticalTileSlices : int16 with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two vertical regions.
Docs.value: The number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default is 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.CompressedDomainTranscode%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.VerticalTileSlices%2A> must be set to 0.
A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value is adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size.
When used in combination with <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder.HorizontalTileSlices%2A>, a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both properties are set to 1, the image is divided into 4 tiles.
